title: QMS catches eye on roadshow
text:
While QMS Media boss Barclay Nettlefold has been running around the United States talking up his QMS Sport business, he appears to have generated more interest than he bargained for.

It is understood the interest of a potential suitor in the data room for QMS Sport has widened to an appetite for the entire company. While Street Talk is not suggesting an offer is on the table, it is understood QMS would be willing to entertain such a move and is starting to get its ducks in a row.

QMS Media boss Barclay Nettlefold has spent the past couple of weeks meeting with interested oarties in QMS Sport. Joe Armao

To recap, QMS said back in August that it was evaluating a range of funding options for QMS Sport, in order to drive shareholder value.

Nettlefold's US roadshow for QMS Sport took him to Los Angeles and New York in the past two weeks. It is understood a handful of parties have been given due diligence materials, although a formal offer has not been submitted for either QMS Sport or the company as a whole.

QMS Media is an outdoor advertising company with assets across digital, static billboard, retail, street furniture and transit categories.

The business has operations in Australia, New Zealand and Indonesia and its shares are up 5.3 per cent this year, to see the company trading with a $310 million market capitalisation.

Nettlefold is the company's biggest shareholder with about a 15 per cent stake.
description: QMS Media boss Barclay Nettlefold appears to have generated more interest than he bargained for on his US roadshow.
